intro: Stutzia covillei, commonly known as the Coville's stutzia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Stutzia covillei is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
